body_html:
From the docs, there is no keyword called target_tensor or data_tensor. You can pass a variable number of arguments to the constructor

x = torch.linspace(1, 10, 10)
y = torch.linspace(10, 1, 10)
dataset = Data.TensorDataset(x, y)
body_text:
From the docs, there is no keyword called target_tensor or data_tensor. You can pass a variable number of arguments to the constructor
x = torch.linspace(1, 10, 10)
y = torch.linspace(10, 1, 10)
dataset = Data.TensorDataset(x, y)
body:
From the [docs](https://pytorch.org/docs/stable/_modules/torch/utils/data/dataset.html#TensorDataset), there is no keyword called `target_tensor` or `data_tensor`. You can pass a variable number of arguments to the constructor
```python
x = torch.linspace(1, 10, 10)
y = torch.linspace(10, 1, 10)
dataset = Data.TensorDataset(x, y)
```
